;柬埔寨对参加有史以来的第一次活动犹豫不决，威胁到东南亚统一区域范围的联合海军演习，分析人士表示，即使没有一个或多个国家的参与，演习仍应继续进行。

;

;印度尼西亚军事首脑尤多·马戈诺 (Yudo Margono) 最近在巴厘岛举行的东盟防长会议后表示，10 - 地区组织成员将在南海举行首次联合军事演习。

;

;演习将重点关注海上安全和救援行动，不会涉及战斗行动。

;

;关于周二，印度尼西亚军方表示，东南亚国家联盟 (ASEAN) 成员国已就联合演习举行了初步规划会议，演习将于 9 月 18 日至 25 日举行。

;

;然而，不久之后柬埔寨皇家武装部队总司令冯皮森 (Vong Pisen) 将军在最初宣布这一消息时发表声明称，柬埔寨尚未同意举行演习。

;

;他表示，虽然印度尼西亚提出了这一想法，但欧盟轮值主席国柬埔寨和“其他几个国家”（未透露姓名）尚未做出回应。

;

;马尼拉国际发展与安全合作智库常驻研究员约书亚·伯纳德·埃斯佩尼亚 (Joshua Bernard Espeña)，表示柬埔寨对演习犹豫不决，因为它在地缘政治和经济上依赖中国。

;

;他表示，如果东盟成员国定期举行海军演习，可以邀请非参加国的军事代表埃斯佩尼亚表示：“[这是]保持东盟团结的信息一致。”他指出，虽然缅甸同样依赖中国，但由于其内部冲突，它不会参加 9 月份的会议。

;

;印尼军队已证实内比都拒绝参加。

;

;自2021年2月政变夺取政权以来，缅甸军政府一直卷入与反抗的武装战争

;

;柬埔寨在援助、贸易和投资方面严重依赖中国，1994 年至 2021 年间，北京为这个东南亚小国的外国直接投资总额贡献了 44%。

;

;新加坡尤索夫伊萨东南亚研究所东盟研究中心联合协调员乔安妮·林伟岭表示，柬埔寨对将在南中国海举行的海军演习地点持谨慎态度。

;

;如果林说，“这对柬埔寨来说可能更容易接受”，并指出金边参加了其他东盟演习，例如上个月在菲律宾苏比克湾海域举行的 2023 年东盟多边海军演习。 /p>;

;雅加达最初表示，9月份的联合演习将在纳土纳群岛东北部的印度尼西亚海域进行，即北纳土纳海。

;

;纳土纳群岛位于印度尼西亚的专属经济区内，但也属于北京声称拥有主权的南海区域。

;

;然而，周二，雅加达表示，目前正计划在南纳土纳海域进行演习，该海域就在北京划定的九段线之外。林表示，柬埔寨支持东盟合作，这将促进东南亚的海上安全，应对共同挑战。林补充说：“只要不激怒其他各方或加剧地区水域的紧张局势，联合演习应该由那些对印度尼西亚倡议“满意”的国家继续进行。

;

;林说，东盟海岸警卫队论坛是由印度尼西亚于11月发起的，旨在加强海上安全，只有八个东盟国家参加了，柬埔寨和缅甸没有参加。

;

;“对于像东盟这样在不同国家之间有着不同利益的组织来说，林说，务实很重要。”他补充说，无法获得所有 10 个东盟成员国支持的举措可能仍会由最直接参与的成员国继续进行。

;

;“其他成员国可能会继续进行。 ”她说。

;

;虽然东盟的中心地位和团结对于该组织的有效性非常重要，但该区域组织只是一个促进合作的政府间组织，林补充道。< /p>;

;“东盟成员国当然不需要与外交或安全政策保持一致，也不需要在涉及该地区大国争夺的其他问题上达成一致，”她说。

;

;亚利桑那州立大学雷鸟全球管理学院副教授索法尔·埃尔 (Sophal Ear) 表示，柬埔寨的不确定性反映出它不想“与中国这个铁杆朋友发生冲突”。

;

;“任何参与的人都得罪中国。任何不参与的人都与中国站在一起。”Ear 表示，并补充说，如果柬埔寨不参与，东盟的团结和中心地位“显然不是那么坚如磐石”，将会受到损害。

;

;但是埃尔指出，演习应该继续进行，因为参与的国家将提高其海军作战和联合能力。

;

;

;

;9 月的演习将是东盟自该机构成立以来的首次联合演习。西苏门答腊岛安达拉斯大学国际关系讲师 Rifki Dermawan 成立于 1967 年。

;

;继续推进这些计划将发出强烈信号，表明东盟正在集体保护该地区。

;

;“中国并不是该地区的唯一威胁，”里夫基说，并指出像奥库斯（澳大利亚、英国和美国）和四国集团（澳大利亚、美国、日本和印度）的紧张局势已经加剧。

;

;这迫使东盟计划进行演习，以确保其在该地区的中心地位和在中东地区的相关性里夫基补充道，这是大国竞争的体现。

;

;埃斯佩尼亚表示，演习向美国和中国发出了这样的信息：虽然华盛顿“不能依靠东盟联合起来对抗中国”，但北京也无法阻止地区国家给予支持。

;

;Iseas 的林指出，随着美国和中国在该地区进行更多的军事演习，大国之间的争端正在加剧。

;

;其中包括美国与多个东盟国家之间的“超级鹰盾”和“金色眼镜蛇”演习、中国与泰国之间的“猎鹰打击”联合空军训练以及中国与老挝之间的“友谊之盾”演习。

;

;安缦友谊-2023 (还计划于今年晚些时候在中国、柬埔寨、老挝、马来西亚、泰国和越南之间举行和平与友谊-2023）演习。

;

;“因此，对于东盟来说，利用其自身优势来增强自身的韧性非常重要。林说：“我们有自己的平台来促进区域合作。”

;中国太平间兼灵堂的邻居称他们是被迫的忍受不断的哀嚎和哭泣，他们制作了一段视频，在大陆社交媒体上获得支持。

;

;在热门视频中，来自中国北部河北省石家庄市的焦姓居民表达了她的心声。距离她家仅50米的太平间让她感到沮丧。

;

;焦女士表示，连续不断的哀号声和哭声使邻居无法打开窗户或无法入睡，造成严重的心理困扰。

;

;“凌晨 4 点，我们被哭声吵醒。然后他们从早上 5 点到 11 点播放悲伤的音乐。中午有短暂的停顿，但随后又恢复到下午 5 点，”她告诉《海峡都市邮报》。

;

;“目前的周期已经连续三天了。但一个家庭的葬礼一结束，几天后另一个家庭就会开始。”

;

;争议延伸到太平间和包括焦在内的其他邻居居住的住宅楼的建设。

;

;争议延伸到太平间和包括焦在内的其他邻居居住的住宅楼的建设。 >;

;焦女士说，她在2008年买了这套公寓，2019年太平间建成之前。然而太平间发言人声称，住宅楼是在太平间建成后建造的。

;

;“我们已经通知了居民关于太平间的位置。发言人表示：“当时买房应该有补贴。”

;

;噪音已经迫使一些居民搬迁。

;

;工作人员表示，他们会降低噪音水平

;

;该视频在内地社交媒体上引发强烈反对和讨论。

;

;有人评论说：“不应该太平间该建在火葬场还是医院？为什么要在路边建一栋呢？抛开迷信不说，这种持续不断的噪音实在是太令人不安了！”

;

;还有人补充道：“如果只是暂时的，也许我能理解。但如果建立永久太平间，就必须拆除。”

;

;还有人说：“如果有人一个人在家，会被吓死的！”

;

;据中国生态环境部发布的年度报告显示，2021年收到的45万起环境投诉中，噪音干扰占45%，仅次于空气污染投诉。

;

;为解决这一问题，中国修订了2022 年 6 月颁布《噪声污染防治法》，对住宅区附近的噪声干扰最高处以 20 万元人民币（28,000 美元）的罚款。

;

;今年早些时候，中国中部地区的一家医院被罚款 56,000 元人民币屋顶空调噪音过大。

Recent incidents raise concerns over quality of drivers, but industry leaders say new measures needed to lure younger workershttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/law-and-crime/article/3224938/how-safe-are-hong-kong-taxis-recent-incidents-raise-concerns-over-quality-drivers-industry-leaders?utm_source=rss_feed

;Alex Li 仍然清楚地记得他的出租车司机睡着了，车辆差一点就到的那一刻。在香港道路上撞上护栏。

;

;“当时我们在高速公路上，但出租车司机睡着了，车辆失去了控制，车辆自行横穿了两条车道，”这位 36 岁的司机说道。 ——老技师说道。 “这真的很危险。”

;

;当他们到达目的地时，幸运的是没有受伤，李给了司机 500 港元（63 美元）的小费，并敦促他立即结束轮班并休息一下。

;

; >;

;对于一位不愿透露姓名的年轻企业高管来说，出租车仪表盘上排列着手机，不断提供有关接载请求的最新信息，这令人担忧。

;

;“有时，出租车司机开始开车离开，乘客们仍在下车，许多司机的仪表盘上都有很多设备，”这位 30 岁的女士说。 “看起来真的很危险。”

;

;上周，两名出租车司机失去对车辆的控制，从路边驶下斜坡，引发了对出租车乘客安全的担忧。两起互不相关的事件于周二在马己仙峡道和6月14日在城门里发生

;

;本周早些时候，一名55岁的出租车司机据称在马己仙峡道将一名游客送到尖沙咀一家酒店，并与该男子的妻子开车离开。据称，他将她带到观塘的一个建筑工地，并在那里滞留了约30分钟。

;

;3月份，一辆出租车疑似失控冲撞行人，造成至少三人受伤。在炮台山下坡行驶时经过十字路口。 84岁司机因涉嫌危险驾驶造成严重人身伤害罪被捕。

;

;据交通运输部门统计，今年第一季度，全市共发生交通事故3,989起，涉及车辆6,600辆。私家车占事故的 37%，其次是出租车，占 17%，是所有形式的公共交通中最多的。

;

;换句话说，总共约 18,000 辆出租车中，至少有 12 辆出租车，每天都会发生事故。

;

;对香港司机进行更严格的健康检查“可能会引发小巴人力问题”

;

;通勤关注组织公共交通发言人郑显基 (Quentin Cheng Hin-kei)研究小组表示，他认为最近的案例是孤立事件，但该市缺乏一种机制来发现不再适合开车的司机。

;

;“如果每个出租车司机都必须这样做，那就更好了定期对其服务质量进行审查，如果有不当行为，将被送去培训或吊销执照。” “但由于人手紧张，加上的士司机是个体户，业界没有动力这样做。”

;

;香港的士及公共小巴联会主席周国强，指出几乎一半的出租车司机年龄在 60 多岁，并表示年龄可能在事故数量中发挥作用。政府此前曾承诺加强对 65 岁以上司机的健康要求。

;

;“八小时轮班对于老年司机来说可能非常具有挑战性，但这就是他们谋生所需要的，”他说，并补充说一些司机每天工作10个小时。 “这就是为什么我们总是要求政府放宽牌照要求并提高出租车费，以吸引更多新鲜血液。”

;

;香港出租车司机希望停止对65岁以上司机进行年度健康检查

;

;出租车司机平均每月收入约20,000港元，必须参加45分钟的笔试才能获得执照，并正确回答90个问题中的至少77个问题才能通过。

;

;Chow说对于一些受教育程度比其他工人低的准司机来说，考试相当困难，而且不习惯参加考试。

;

;“很多选择题都很不切实际，比如问某些建筑物的位置，尽管每个人都知道使用 GPS 进行导航，”他说。 “但必须答对 85% 的答案才能获得执照。这绝对不容易。”

;

;拥有驾驶执照的年轻人会选择加入叫车服务，而不是参加考试，这在工作时间方面提供了更大的灵活性，而且副业的薪水也不错，周补充道。

;

;香港的士联会主席黄卓邦博士表示，道路上全天候存在的出租车数量达到 17%，这可能是其占有率达到 17% 的一个因素。 ”，但强调乘客并不会仅仅因为司机年龄较大而面临更大的风险。

;

;“从统计数据来看，大多数发生事故的司机都是老年司机，但我们不应该忘记，大多数发生交通事故的司机都是老年司机。香港的出租车司机本来就不年轻，”他说。 “我们与理工大学进行的一项模拟实验发现，与年轻司机相比，老年司机开车时确实更安全，因为他们知道自己的身体极限，并且会妥善管理自己的风险。”

;

;Wong 表示，该行业致力于更好地利用技术来降低事故风险，包括在驾驶员偏离车道或有碰撞风险时发出警告的系统，以及在驾驶员打瞌睡时发出警报的设备。

;< p>;政府的智能交通基金已允许在约 1,000 辆车辆上安装部分设备，但 Wong 呼吁提供更多资金以帮助扩大覆盖范围。

;

;他还同意当前的考试制度运输署指出，所有的士牌照申请人均须参加旨在提高驾驶安全意识的课程。自2020年10月起。

;

;为吸引更多新鲜血液，公安部还放宽了商用车驾驶证的要求，并根据实际需要调整了笔试题目。

;

;由于供应迫在眉睫，香港周末房屋销售下滑

;

;“高利率是我们目前必须解决的问题之一，”总经理 Thomas Lam 表示亨德森的销售量，并补充说现在是买家进入市场的时候了。

;

;随着下半年经济的回升，需求也会增加，从而推高价格。

;

;他补充道。 >;

;高明集团周三以平均折扣价每平方尺18,526港元的价格出售土瓜湾The Grands的30个单位，其中24个单位的售价低于500万港元。

; Thu, 22 Jun 2023 08:50:02 +0800 US House approves Taiwan trade deal, demands future oversighthttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/article/3224948/us-house-passes-first-agreement-taiwan-trade-deal-demands-future-oversight?utm_source=rss_feed

;美国众议院周三投票通过了美国签署的第一份协议-台湾21世纪贸易倡议，并要求国会就未来的谈判进行磋商。

;

;该协议于6月1日在去年启动的双边会谈框架下签署，涵盖简化海关程序、打击腐败和帮助小企业企业遵守两个市场的监管程序。它的总体目标是加强美台贸易和经济关系，但不包括任何市场准入条款。

;

;观察人士表示，该法案以口头表决方式获得通过，现已移交参议院，其内容与关于维护国会对贸易政策的权威，因为这意味着支持加强与台湾的经济接触。

;

;虽然政府有权在不要求修改美国法律的情况下谈判此类协议，但总部位于华盛顿的 Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld 律师事务所合伙人克莱特·威廉姆斯 (Clete Willems) 表示，行政决策与国会监督之间的政治平衡“不正常”。

;

;威廉姆斯表示，周三的法案有助于填补这一空白。指导政府谈判交易的贸易促进授权法到期后留下的空白。拜登政府尚未要求国会授予此类权力，而这是谈判包含市场准入组成部分的贸易协定所必需的。

;

;这项立法是由参议院财政委员会和众议院两党领导人本月早些时候宣布的。众议院法案的发起人、筹款委员会主席杰森·史密斯众议员周三表示：“美国和台湾之间的关系对于美国在印度的利益至关重要。太平洋地区。”

;

;“拜登政府谈判达成的这项初步贸易协议是迈出的良好一步......它向世界表明，中国共产党不会恐吓美国深化与台湾的关系，”他

;

;“国会今天向[乔]拜登总统发出了两党共同的信息，即我们不会袖手旁观，因为政府忽视了我们在制定美国贸易政策方面的宪法作用，”来自共和党的史密斯补充道。密苏里州。

;

;分析人士称，美台贸易倡议标志着方式的转变

;

;该法案要求美国贸易代表办公室向国会展示该倡议下的任何未来谈判文本在与台湾或行政部门以外的任何各方共享之前；在谈判期间向国会提供每日简报；并在三天内分享台湾起草的任何文本。

;

;它还要求，除非美国总统在达成协议前 60 天公开文本并颁布批准该文本的法案，否则未来的协议不会生效

;

;美国-台湾商业全国委员会主席鲁珀特·哈蒙德-钱伯斯 (Rupert Hammond-Chambers) 表示，该协议表明，双方有“不断增强的雄心”，以加强与台湾的贸易接触。

;

;“它创造了一些动力，创造了更多的野心，”他说，并指出拜登政府与唐纳德·特朗普总统领导下对台湾贸易协定表现出的“敌意”之间的区别。

;

;但随着野心不断扩大随着越来越多的声音加入争论，哈蒙德-钱伯斯表示，双方通过行政行动进行接触将变得更加困难。

;

;“在贸易问题上缺乏更广泛的共识以及对自由贸易协定的敌意的情况下“在美国的许多地方，对台湾实行强有力的、理想的贸易政策将变得更加复杂，”他说。

;

;虽然对全面自由贸易协定的渴望可能是复杂的，但国会越来越多地表示其希望美国加强与台湾的经济接触。

;

;参众两院目前正在考虑一项法案，授权政府与台北谈判一项税收协定，该协定将为美国和台湾居民提供免于双重征税的减免。

; Thu, 22 Jun 2023 08:20:02 +0800 Is China taking a tactical step back in the face of a still powerful US? Perhapshttps://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3224724/china-taking-tactical-step-back-face-still-powerful-us-perhaps?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.22 08:15;
;;

;US-China relations have been so bad, and the chain of recent events that led up to Antony Blinken's visit to China – the first by a US secretary of state in nearly five years – had put so much attention on it, that his appearance in Beijing on Sunday was nothing short of melodramatic.

;

;The widely held pessimism about the prospects for Blinken's two-day visit has turned into a subtle sense of triumph. This is in contrast to the efforts of both sides to tamp down expectations of the potential significance of the visit before it started.

;

;At a media briefing on June 14, Daniel Kritenbrink, US assistant secretary of state for East Asian and Pacific affairs, who had made a trip to Beijing to prepare for Blinken's visit, said his boss was going to Beijing to keep communication channels open, to stand up for American values and interests and to cooperate where the two sides can, in areas such as “climate and global macroeconomic stability”. That sounded more like posturing than foretelling anything substantive.

;

;Kurt Campbell, coordinator for Indo-Pacific affairs on the National Security Council, said during the same briefing that “after investing at home and strengthening ties with allies abroad, now is precisely the time for intense diplomacy” with Beijing, adding that the United States is doing so “from a position of confidence in ourselves and in the importance of consistent, clear and high-level communication with other great powers”.

;

;That ominously brought to mind a scene in Anchorage, Alaska, in March 2021. Yang Jiechi, then China's top diplomat, responded to Blinken's similarly expressed views by insisting that “the US does not have the qualification to say to China it wants to speak to China from a position of strength”.

;

;Adding to efforts to dampen expectations was a phone call between Blinken and his Chinese counterpart Qin Gang. According to Chinese sources, Qin “made clear China's solemn position on the Taiwan question and China's other core concerns”. For his part, Blinken, before leaving for Beijing, was quoted as saying that “intense competition requires sustained diplomacy to ensure that competition does not veer into confrontation or conflict”.

;

;With all that said, Blinken's visit seems to have been a success, sealed by President Xi Jinping's personal reception of him towards the end of his time in Beijing. Xi said “China respects the interests of the United States and does not seek to challenge or displace the United States”, adding that “the United States must also respect China and not harm China's legitimate rights and interests”.

;

;Blinken's response did not appear to go beyond what US President Joe Biden has told Xi in their meetings. One needs to remember that Chinese officials have accused the American side of not following through on their statements and warned that China would not accept talking merely for the sake of talking.

;

;It is anyone's guess whether Blinken's team reached any tacit agreement with their Chinese hosts regarding the latter's persistent warnings over Taiwan, which Beijing's representatives have described as the “core of China's core interests”. On the surface of it, though, Beijing appeared accommodative towards Blinken, who did not seem to budge much on the existing US stance towards China.

;

;Is China taking a tactical step back in the face of a still powerful US?也许。 After all, it has shown its determination to confront the US presence near its border with its military's recent harassing of a US reconnaissance aircraft over the South China Sea and of a US warship in the Taiwan Strait. This has been accompanied by a refusal of repeated US requests for the two sides' defence ministers to have bilateral meetings to avoid military miscalculations.

;

;However, it is worth pointing out that in the meantime China is continuing its vigorous efforts to woo US businesses. The latest wave of initiatives on that front started with a visit to China by Tesla CEO Elon Musk, who has a reputation for being innovative.

;

;According to China's foreign ministry, he told Qin in Beijing on May 30 that the interests of the US and China were “intertwined like conjoined twins”. He appeared to be bullish and upbeat when addressing his Chinese staff in Shanghai.

;

;It should not escape people's attention that Musk leans politically towards the Republican Party. Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, whose popularity among Republican voters is second only to that of former president Donald Trump, launched his candidacy for the 2024 presidential election late last month on Twitter during a scheduled conversation with Musk.

;

;Preceding Blinken's visit was the arrival in China of Microsoft co-founder and philanthropist Bill Gates. Xi granted Gates an audience in Beijing on June 16 and called him “an old friend”, telling him that he believes “the foundation of China-US relations lies in the people” and that it is in them that he places his hopes for good relations between the two countries.

;

;Beijing's reckoning seems to be that as long as business interchanges are maintained between the world's two largest economies in spite of any intense competition, the odds are that China will sustain its momentum to rise peacefully.

;

;Thus, life goes on in a world fraught with uncertainty and concerns occasioned by the US-China rivalry. As JPMorgan chief operating officer Daniel Pinto put it, “we have to learn to live with” this tension between the US and China.

; Thu, 22 Jun 2023 08:20:02 +0800 Women are more likely to be affected by AI automation at work than men, according to Goldman Sachs reporthttps://www.scmp.com/economy/global-economy/article/3224920/women-are-more-likely-be-affected-ai-automation-work-men-according-goldman-sachs-report?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.22 07:30;
;;

;Women are likely to be disproportionately impacted by artificial intelligence (AI) automation while women in Asia's major economies still suffer more from gender disparity in the workforce, according to a report by Goldman Sachs.

;

;Women are more likely to be affected by the changes that AI will bring due to the kind of jobs they do. Women are more likely to work in service sectors than men and remain less represented in fields where AI may have less impact, such as construction and maintenance, according to the Women (Still) Hold Up Half the Sky report.

;

;“The majority of people in the high exposure category [to AI] are women,” the report states, adding that the impact of AI is likely to be higher in developed markets than in emerging markets, given the higher share of service sector jobs in developed economies.

;

;According to a recent report by IT recruiter Venturenix, financial services hub Hong Kong could see a quarter of its workforce being replaced by 2028, leaving 800,000 Hongkongers out of work.

;

;Moreover, the lack of women in the AI industry poses a challenge for gender equity going forward, according to the Goldman Sachs report, as women currently make up only 20 per cent of AI and data professionals.

;

;Will ChatGPT and similar generative AI tools worsen China's job crisis?

;

;According to the World Economic Forum's Global Gender Gap Report 2023, the education sector has the most female AI talent, accounting for 40 per cent of the total. Female AI talent in fields like technology, information, media, and manufacturing remains at less than 25 per cent of the total.

;

;However, one positive area for women, according to the Goldman Sachs report, is that in some female-dominated industries, such as the caring services sector, AI will likely aid people to be more productive and there will be less job substitution.

;

;Meanwhile, women in Asia's major economies such as India, China, Japan, and South Korea still suffer from a gender gap in terms of job participation and wages, according to the report.

;

;In India and China, the recorded female labour force participation rate (LFPR) has seen a big drop in the last decade. India's LFPR fell by more than 10 per cent, with a mere 20 per cent of all working-age women in employment.

;

;China also saw a drop of more than 5 per cent, giving the country an LFPR rate of around 60 per cent. But this rate is still higher than in some major developed countries, including the United States, Japan, Australia, and Italy.

;

;Japan and South Korea have the largest gender pay gap among developed economies, even though both countries have seen a significant narrowing of the gap in the last decade, according to the report.

;

;Meanwhile, China and Japan still have fewer women leaders than other major economies such as the US, Germany, Britain, and France. In these two countries, women leaders in major public companies account for around 15 per cent of the total, while this number stands at around 40 per cent in major Western countries, according to the report.

;

;According to World Economic Forum data, South Korea, Japan, and India are among the lowest-ranking major economies in terms of economic participation and the opportunity index. These three countries rank 114th, 123rd, and 142nd respectively out of 146 countries. China ranks 45th.

;

;Southeast Asian countries such as Laos, Philippines, Singapore, and Thailand, on the other hand, have more active female economic participation, ranking 5th, 17th, 23rd, and 24th respectively.

; Thu, 22 Jun 2023 07:50:01 +0800 4,000-year-old ‘Dutch Stonehenge’ site unveiled in the Netherlandshttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/europe/article/3224939/4000-year-old-dutch-stonehenge-site-unveiled-netherlands?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.22 07:48;
;;

;Dutch archaeologists on Wednesday revealed an around 4,000-year-old religious site – dubbed the “Stonehenge of the Netherlands” in the country's media – which included a burial mound serving as a solar calendar.

;

;The burial mound, which contained the remains of some 60 men, women and children had several passages through which the sun directly shone on the longest and shortest days of the year.

;

;“What a spectacular archaeological discovery! Archaeologists have found a 4,000-year-old religious sanctuary on an industrial site,” the town of Tiel said on its Facebook page.

;

;“This is the first time a site like this has been discovered in the Netherlands,” it added in a statement.

;

;Diggings around the so-called “open-air sanctuary” started in 2017 in the small village about 50km (31 miles) southeast of Utrecht, with the results made public on Wednesday.

;

;Studying a difference in clay composition and colour, the scientists located three burial mounds on the excavations, a few kilometres from the banks of the Waal river.

;

;The main mound is about 20 metres (65 feet) in diameter with its passages lined up to serve as a solar calendar.

;

;“People used this calendar to determine important moments including festival and harvest days,” the archaeologists said.

;

;“This hill reminded one of Stonehenge, the well-known mysterious prehistoric monument in Britain, where this phenomenon also occurs,” NOS, the Dutch national broadcaster, added.

;

;Scientists also discovered two other smaller mounds. The three mounds were used as burial sites for about 800 years, the archaeologists said.

;

;They made another fascinating discovery: a single glass bead inside a grave, which after analysis was shown to have originated in Mesopotamia, today's Iraq.

;

;“This bead travelled a distance of some 5,000km, four millennia ago,” said chief researcher Cristian van der Linde.

;

;'Remarkable' ring of ancient pits found near Britain's Stonehenge

;

;“Glass was not made here, so the bead must have been a spectacular item as for people then it was an unknown material,” added Stijn Arnoldussen, professor at the University of Groningen.

;

;He told the NOS that the Mesopotamian bead may have been around for a long time before eventually ending up in the area around Tiel, called the Betuwe in Dutch.

;

;“Things were already being exchanged in those times. The bead may have been above ground for hundreds of years before it reached Tiel, but of course, it didn't have to be,” Arnoldussen said.

; Thu, 22 Jun 2023 07:50:01 +0800 Alibaba chief strategist says ‘more important’ to focus on small business as China’s economy slowshttps://www.scmp.com/tech/big-tech/article/3224872/alibaba-chief-strategist-says-more-important-focus-small-business-chinas-economy-slows?utm_source=rss_feed

;;

;It is more important than ever for Alibaba Group Holding to focus on small businesses and merchants, the group's president for strategic planning said on Wednesday, endorsing a strategic business pivot initiated by its founder Jack Ma.

;

;Chen Long, also president of Luohan Academy, an open research institute backed by Alibaba, told the South China Morning Post in Hangzhou that Alibaba has always considered small business to be the backbone of its platform, and that it was getting “more important” to help small merchants amid China's consumption slowdown.

;

;“Helping small businesses grow has to be the future for any platform because they represent the future … Alibaba was born to help [small businesses], and it should be this way in the future,” Chen said on the sidelines of the Luohan Academy digital economy conference. “It becomes more important [to help small businesses] given the current circumstances” of dampened consumer sentiment in the world's second-largest economy, he added.

;

;JD.com sets out ambitious e-commerce growth plan on anniversary day

;

;Chen's comments came a day after Alibaba, which owns the Post, announced that Daniel Zhang Yong will step down as the group's chairman and CEO in September to focus on the cloud business, with Joe Tsai and Eddie Wu Yongming, two key figures involved in the founding of Alibaba, taking over the chairman and CEO positions, respectively.

;

;Chen's comments also echoed an internal speech made by Jack Ma in late May, where he reportedly told management that Alibaba should refocus on Taobao and consumers to survive brutal competition and weather China's economic slowdown.

;

;Chen did not directly comment on Ma's reported remarks.

;

;Chen said China's consumer spending was in a transition period, as the pandemic had hurt people's incomes and weakened consumer confidence. On top of the cyclical shocks resulting from the pandemic, China is also facing long-term headwinds as growth engines underpinning the country's prosperity in past years, from real estate investment to exports, are losing steam.

;

;“People are getting more cautious, both in terms of their abilities and expectations,” Chen said. But he added that over the long run he was optimistic about China's growth and consumer spending power.

;

;The Luohan Academy was founded in 2018 as an open research institute to pull together “social scientists” to discuss important issues. The 2023 edition of the digital economy conference featured two days of discussion on topics such as “technology and the future of human society”, with speakers including Nobel laureates Thomas Sargent, a New York University professor, and Eric Maskin, a Harvard University professor.

;

;The stepson of British billionaire Hamish Harding, who is one of the passengers aboard a missing submersible, is taking comfort in all the small things – by attending a Blink-182 concert.

;

;“@blink182 ⁦ @tomdelonge @travisbarker@markhoppis My stepdad Hamish is on this submarine lost at sea. I'm devastated but coming to the San Diego show tonight so you guys can give me hope and cheer me up,” San Diego resident Brian Szasz tweeted on Monday evening, addressing the band's core members while the US Coast Guard searches for the submersible.

;

;Harding, chairman of Dubai-based aviation sales and acquisitions company Action Aviation, is one of the five people aboard the tourist submersible that went missing Sunday.

;

;On social media, Szasz has been raising awareness about the disappearance of his stepfather and the Titan vessel, which left St John's on Friday for its expedition of the Titanic wreck in the North Atlantic. Szasz also shared on Twitter and Facebook that he is finding comfort in music amid his stepfather's disappearance.

;

;“It might be distasteful being here but my family would want me to be at the blink-182 show as it's my favorite band and music helps me in difficult times!,” Szasz wrote in a since-deleted Facebook post. In the photo, Szasz stands in front of a Blink-182 merchandise stand outside San Diego's Pechanga Arena.

;

;“Blink 182 gets us through life's toughest times!,” Szasz tweeted on Tuesday.

;

;The missing vessel was designed with a 96-hour sustainment capability if there is any emergency on board. US Coast Guard Rear Admiral John W. Mauger said in a press conference on Monday that officials “anticipate that there is somewhere between the 70 to full 96 hours” of oxygen. It's estimated there is about a day's supply of oxygen remaining, as of Wednesday.

;

;“We are exploring and mobilising all options to bring the crew back safely,” said OceanGate Expeditions, the company behind the visit to the Titanic wreck, in a release on Monday.

;

;Who is on board missing Titanic tour submersible?

;

;One of the social media users who shared their opinions on Szasz's coping style was rapper Cardi B, who slammed the San Diego resident for finding comfort in concerts.

;

;“You supposed to be at the house sad, you supposed to be crying for me,” she said in an Instagram story shared on Tuesday. “You supposed to be right next to a phone waiting to hear any updates about me. You supposed to be consoling your mum.”

;

;The I Like It musician said that she would rather “be broke and poor but knowing that I'm loved”. Szasz was not a fan of what the rapper he called a “trashy celeb” had to say.

;

;“Cardi B trying to get clout off me and my families suffering,” he tweeted on Wednesday. “I went to a Blink 182 concert for coping rather than sitting at home and watching the news. Shame on you Cardi get some class!”

;

;As Szasz went viral, allegations of online harassment and stalking against the rock fan resurfaced on social media. In the summer of 2021, Szasz allegedly posted threatening tweets to women in the rave community. EDM artist Alison Wonderland was allegedly among those targeted by Szasz social media posts.

;

;In several since-deleted tweets from 2021 that resurfaced via screenshots this week, Szasz singled out Wonderland, writing she “will f****** pay and I will show up to her LA apartment”. The musician was set to perform with DJ Illenium in Las Vegas in July.

;

;“My team and I are aware of the situation and are working with authorities and the stadium on it. My #1 priority at any of my shows is for fans to feel safe,” Illenium tweeted in June 2021.

;

;“We take all threats seriously and anyone making them will be reported to police and not allowed into the venue.”

;

;

;According to legal documents, Szasz was detained on June 30, 2021, at Vista Detention Facility “in connection with online stalking charges pressed against him”.

;

;A year after his detainment, Szasz filed a lawsuit against San Diego County alleging several Vista Detention Facility workers of “negligence, intentional infliction of emotional distress, battery”. As of May, the case is still in litigation.

;

;A legal representative for Szasz did not immediately respond to the LA Times' request for comment on Wednesday.
